description:

re-cladding of the tower; the re-building/extension of the
podium; and an increase in office and retail accommodation
within the building together with changes to vehicular and
pedestrian access and parking and the inclusion of a

decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - No process shall be carried on or machinery installed which
    is not such as could be carried on or installed in any
    residential area without detriment to the amenity of that
    area by reason of noise, vibration, smell, fumes, smoke,
    soot, ash, dust or grit.

Condition : 2 - At 1 metre outside the windows of any neighbouring habitable room the level of noise from all plant and machinery shall be at all times at least 5 decibels below the existing background noise levels, expressed in dB(A) at such locations. Where the noise from the plant and machinery is tonal in character the differences in these levels shall be at least 10 dB(A).

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the [adjoining] premises [and the area generally] in accordance with the requirements of policy[ies] RE2[, EN5, EN6 and DS6] of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 3 - The air conditioning units shall be fitted with automatic
    time clock switches, prior to the commencement of the use of
    the units.  The use of the units shall cease between 2000
    hours and 0800 hours.  The timer operation equipment shall
    be properly maintained and retained permanently thereafter.

Condition : 4 - No plant (or air handling equipment) shall be provided on
    the site without full details (including an acoustic report)
    having been submitted to and approved by the Council,
    thereafter the plant shall be installed and maintained in
    accordance with the approved plans.

Condition : 5 - Details of the screening to the proposed air handling units
    at fourth floor level on the Percy Street frontage, shall be
    submitted to and approved by the Council prior to the
    installation of the units.  The screening shall be erected
    prior to the commencement of the use of the air handling
    units.

Condition : 6 - No construction shall take place until a detailed design and
    method statement for all foundations and other development
    proposed below ground level which takes account of the
    proposed running tunnels of the Chelsea/Hackney Project
    including any ground movements arising from the construction
    of the Chelsea/Hackney tunnels, has been submitted to and
    approved by the Council.

Condition : 7 - No development shall take place before details of layout for
    cycle parking provision for employees and visitors in
    accordance with Council standards have been submitted to and
    approved by the Council. The layout as approved should be
    implemented and retained for that purpose for the duration
    of the approved use.

Condition : 8 - No development shall take place until full details of hard
    and soft landscaping have been submitted to and approved by
    the Council.

Condition : 9 - All hard and soft landscaping works shall be carried out to
    following planting season, with others of similar size and
    species, unless the Council gives written consent to any
    variation.
    a reasonable standard in accordance with the approved
    landscape details, prior to the occupation for the permitted
    use of the development or any phase of the development,
    whichever is the sooner. Any trees or areas of planting
    which, within a period of 5 years from the completion of the
    development, die, are removed or become seriously damaged or
    diseased, shall be replaced as soon as is reasonably
    possible and, in any case, by not later than the end of the

Condition : 10 - Details of the stone artwork to be erected on the Percy
    Street facade shall be submitted to and approved by the
    Council before any work on site is commenced.

Condition : 11 - The development shall be constructed in strict accordance
    with the drawings hereby approved or drawings, which are
    subsequently approved pursuant to conditions, which are
    attached to this planning permission.

Condition : 12 - Before the use commences, details of the method of storage
    and waste removal shall be submitted to and approved by the
    Council and the approved method shall thereafter be
    maintained.

Condition : 13 - In order to ensure that the new development is adequately
    protected against the penetration of noise in accordance
    with the requirements of policy RE2 of the London Borough of
    Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 14 - To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the
    area generally in order to ensure compliance with the
    requirements of policy RE2 of the London Borough of Camden
    Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 15 - To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the
    area generally in order to ensure compliance with the
    requirements of policy RE2 of the London Borough of Camden
    Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 16 - To ensure that the use can be accomodated without detriment
    to the amenity of the surrounding premises by reason of
    noise in order to ensure compliance with the requirements of
    policy RE2 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary
    Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 17 - To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the
    area generally in order to ensure compliance with the
    requirements of policy RE2 of the London Borough of Camden
    Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 18 - So that the Council and the Cross Rail Project Team may be
    satisfied that the proposed CrossRail Project is adequately
    safeguarded, in accordance with the requirements of policy
    TR5 and as set out in T2 of the Schedule of Transport
    Proposals, of the London Borough of Camden Unitary
    Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 19 - To ensure the availability of cycling facilities in
    accordance with the requirements of policy TR22 of the
    London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 20 - In order that the Council may give consideration to the
    details of the proposed development.

Condition : 21 - To ensure that the landscaping is carried out within a
    reasonable period and to maintain a satisfactory standard of
    visual amenity in the scheme in accordance with the
    requirements of policies EN15 of the London Borough of
    Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 22 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied with the
    external appearance of the building in accordance with the
    requirements of policies EN1 and EN13 of the London Borough
    of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 23 - To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the
    character of the immediate area in accordance with the
    requirements of policies EN1 and EN13 of the London Borough
    of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 24 - To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the
    area generally in accordance with the requirements of policy
    RE2 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan
    2000.
